documentType: FBI investigative note or to-do list
summary: This document appears to be an FBI investigative note or checklist outlining tasks and interviews related to Jeffrey Epstein's death and will. It mentions a claim by someone named Noel, coordination with a suicide prevention coordinator, and tasks to review emails and search for Epstein's will.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Makes a claim about being instructed by someone (text cut off) and is mentioned in relation to signing training documents.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; his will was revised the day before an event, and he was removed from the MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center).

persons.name: Unidentified DUSM
persons.context: Mentioned regarding a suicide tendency note; investigators need to review emails to identify this person.

events.title: Review of emails regarding Epstein's removal
events.description: Instructions to review emails from July 30/31 regarding Jeffrey Epstein being removed from the MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center).

events.title: Revision of Epstein's will
events.description: Epstein's will was revised the day before an unspecified event, with information about this coming from an email.

keyFacts: Epstein's will was revised the day before a key event, and investigators are tasked with finding it via probate court.
A claim was made by someone named Noel about being instructed to sign training documents.
Investigators need to identify a Deputy U.S. Marshal (DUSM) regarding a suicide tendency note by reviewing emails from July 30/31 about Epstein's removal from the MCC.
The document indicates coordination with a National Suicide Prevention Coordinator and a psychologist regarding information about the will.
